00011 #include "AtomArray.h"
00012 
00013 namespace DdMd
00014 {
00015 
00016    /*
00017    * Constructor.
00018    *
00019    * The data_ and capacity_ are nullified in Array<Atom> constructor.
00020    */
00021    AtomArray::AtomArray() 
00022     : Array<Atom>()
00023    {}
00024 
00025    /*
00026    * Destructor.
00027    */
00028    AtomArray::~AtomArray()
00029    {
00030       if (data_) {
00031          delete [] data_;
00032       }
00033    }
00034 
00035    /*
00036    * Allocate the underlying C array.
00037    */
00038    void AtomArray::allocate(int capacity) 
00039    {
00040       if (!(data_ == 0)) {
00041          UTIL_THROW("Cannot re-allocate an AtomArray");
00042       }
00043       if (capacity <= 0) {
00044          UTIL_THROW("Cannot allocate with capacity <= 0");
00045       }
00046       data_     = new Atom[capacity];
00047       capacity_ = capacity;
00048    }
00049 
00050    /*
00051    * Return true if this is already allocated, false otherwise.
00052    */
00053    bool AtomArray::isAllocated() const 
00054    {  return !(data_ == 0); }
00055 
00056 }
00057 #endif
